trans-unit.source: Represents a configuration element that defines auditing-related configuration settings for a behavior.
This class cannot be inherited.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Configuration.ServiceSecurityAuditElement"></xref> class.
Gets or sets the location of the audit log.
A valid <xref href="System.ServiceModel.AuditLogLocation"></xref> value that specifies the location of the audit log.
The default value is <xref href="System.ServiceModel.AuditLogLocation.Default"></xref>.
Gets the type of this behavior configuration element.
The type of the behavior.
Copies the contents of the specified configuration element to this <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Configuration.ServiceSecurityAuditElement"></xref> object.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Configuration.ServiceModelExtensionElement"></xref> that represents the configuration element to copy.
Gets or sets the type of message authentication level that is used to log audit events.
A valid <xref href="System.ServiceModel.AuditLevel"></xref> value that specifies the type of message authentication level that is used to log audit events.
The default value is <xref href="System.ServiceModel.AuditLevel.None"></xref>.
Gets or sets the types of authorization events that are recorded in the audit log.
A valid <xref href="System.ServiceModel.AuditLevel"></xref> value that specifies the type of authorization events that are recorded in the audit log.
The default value is <xref href="System.ServiceModel.AuditLevel.None"></xref>.
Gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies the behavior for suppressing failures of writing to the audit log.
Applications should be notified for failures of writing to the audit log.
If your application is not designed to handle audit failures, you should use this property to suppress failures in writing to the audit log.

`true` if exceptions other than <xref href="System.OutOfMemoryException"></xref>, <xref href="System.StackOverflowException"></xref>, <xref href="System.Threading.ThreadAbortException"></xref>, and <xref href="System.ArgumentException"></xref> that result from attempts to write audit events are handled by the system, and are not propagated to the application; `false` if all exceptions that result from attempts to write audit events are passed up to the application.
The default is `true`.
